{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3128131,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T16:39:57.102Z","cooked":"

Hello. Can anyone help me determine if this Electric Actuator is legal based on the rules for this year? I see that in section 9.5 of the game manual is lists out all the legal motors and has a line that says ‚ÄúLinear actuators rated for 12V and wired downstream of a breaker 20A or less‚Äù. Would this device fall under that category? I searched a lot of the old messages with the same type of question and they seem to point to the motor itself, which is this case seems to be a snow blower type motor available from andymark. The description calls it an Electric Linear Actuator.

Thanks in advance on any advice.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T16:39:57.102Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":156,"reads":288,"readers_count":287,"score":842.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.e-motioninc.com/Double_Rack_Actuator_p/p-200.htm","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Dual rack and pinion actuator","clicks":103}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/1","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3128135,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T16:44:08.208Z","cooked":"

Probably so. Prior to 2023, ‚ÄúLinear Actuator‚Äù was not an approved ‚Äúmotor‚Äù, which is why so many actuators had to be re-motored to be legal.
You are limited to putting this behind a 20A (or smaller) breaker!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T16:45:08.017Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":69.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/2","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128138,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T16:47:18.668Z","cooked":"
khope:

they seem to point to the motor itself

This is a rule that‚Äôs changed. Formerly, linear actuators with integrated motors weren‚Äôt separated out, thus the motor had to be replaced. With the rules as they are, pretty much any linear actuator is allowed, so long as you have it on a 20A breaker.

khope:

which is this case seems to be a snow blower type motor available from andymark

I wouldn‚Äôt make any assumptions about the motor power/speed based on appearance - you never know unless they spec it for you. But it does appear to have an integrated gearbox similar to a few that we‚Äôve had in FIRST (Snow Blower, Window, Seat, etc).

I would say yes, this is legal.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T16:47:18.668Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":115.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128159,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T16:59:03.574Z","cooked":"

Thanks. I actually just called the company to ask for specs. They gave me email address to reach the ‚Äúexpert‚Äù. I was hoping that the line in the manual about Linear Actuators was a new addition that might allow these. I now just need to make sure the thing will run behind a 20A fuse.

Thanks for quick responses.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T16:59:03.574Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/4","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128175,"name":"Eric Tate","username":"MrT8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrt8/{size}/9889_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T17:07:29.909Z","cooked":"

Once you fins out the Full Load Amps (FLA), that should tell you. Don‚Äôt see a full specification sheet via that link. I would ask for one. Legality only really requires that it be a ‚ÄúLinear Actuator‚Äù, Designed to run on 12Vdc and you use it downstream of a 20A breaker - pretty open to many such devices.

This makes it sooo much easier than before when we had to graft approved motors onto them.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T17:07:29.909Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":49.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"Eric Tate","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31620,"username":"khope","name":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31332,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128191,"name":"khope","username":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T17:32:28.887Z","cooked":"

Here‚Äôs response from the company: Our motors for this series are made by A&M, and have been approved in the past for FRC competitions. Please see the link to the motors themselves here, our higher speed unit is the 210 series, and the higher force and our most ‚Äústandard‚Äù is the 214: Motion Products ‚Äî AM Equipment

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T17:32:28.887Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"khope","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amequipment.com/dc-gear-motor-products","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Motion Products ‚Äî AM Equipment","clicks":30}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31620,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4779 - The RoboSapiens"},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/6","custom_user_title":"4779 - The RoboSapiens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128270,"name":"Eric Tate","username":"MrT8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrt8/{size}/9889_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T19:00:13.267Z","cooked":"

Oddly, they give you almost everything but the current draws. For this type of automotive motor, there should be a free run current which will likely be well under 10A and a stall current that could well be over 20A. These motors also tend to have thermal protection that will shut them off after any extended stall period. You are likely fine using this with a 20A breaker but I would want the manufacturer‚Äôs electrical specifications to be supplied to me.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T19:00:13.267Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":37.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"Eric Tate","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31620,"username":"khope","name":"khope","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f6c823/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31332,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128416,"name":"ChuckDickerson","username":"ChuckDickerson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/e79b87/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T22:14:06.950Z","cooked":"

Is it a ‚Äúlinear actuator‚Äù? Yep, looks like it is to me right in the description.

Is it rated for 12VDC? Yep, says so right in the description.

Is it legal? As long as you use it downstream of a 20A breaker I don‚Äôt see why not.

Cool find! Thanks!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T22:14:06.950Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":16.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423555,"topic_slug":"legal-linear-actuator","display_username":"ChuckDickerson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3436,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Global Lead Robot Inspector"},"post_url":"/t/legal-linear-actuator/423555/8","custom_user_title":"FRC Global Lead Robot Inspector","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3128551,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T00:47:07.872Z","cooked":"

@khope, in case you don‚Äôt know ‚ÄúWho‚Äôs who,‚Äù when one of Chuck Dickerson or Al Skierkiewicz (the Chief Robot Inspectors) says ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt see why [this part is] not [legal]‚Äù, that‚Äôs as close as you‚Äôre going to get to an authoritative ‚ÄúYes, this is a legal part.‚Äù (Excepting only if they both say it.)

Also, you‚Äôre almost certainly going to be able to get this actuator to perform behind a 20A fuse. 800 in-lb/s is about 90W. 20A at 12V is 240W, so unless efficiency is less than 40% (OK, that‚Äôs actually likely), you‚Äôre good even before allowing for breaker curves. For runs of a few seconds, you can count on a good multiplier from the breaker. It‚Äôs pretty likely you can use it straight up on a relay, but I recommend implementing it on a motor controller so you can use a voltage ramp or current limit if it turns out you need it (that is, you trip that 20A breaker).
